page.title: 08HOME LIFE IN HAWICK
page.content: Hawick householders call for the local Fire Brigade,which serves a large area and employs 28 fulltime and 14 parttime men,approximately 250 times a year.On nearly all occasions these are for very minor fires,usually the result of carelessness. Chimney fires are far less of a problem in recent years as more and more people use gas or electric central heating.Chip pan fires are still a frequent occurrence. Potato chips are a very important part of the Northerners diet.They are either bought from the local chippie wrapped in newspaper to keep them warm or are fried at home in saucepans of deep ,very hot oil.This can be dangerous particulary when using a gas cooker.
